title: 110_hr333
content: The Act is titled the "Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act" and allows military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation concurrently. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code to include retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt of retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Disabled Veterans Tax Termination Act amends section 1414 of title 10, United States Code by removing certain subsections and paragraphs related to disability retirees with less than 20 years of service. Section 1414 of title 10, United States Code is amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Section 1414 of title 10, United States Code is amended to allow concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible members. Additionally, combat-related special compensation eligibility is extended to Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The eligibility for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation is amended for eligible members with combat-related disabilities. This includes Chapter 61 military retirees with less than 20 years of service. The amendments under chapter 61 of this title reduce payments for members with less than 20 years of service. The changes take effect after the enactment of the Act and apply to payments starting from that date.
